bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mrs. Edward J. Dimock, November 22, 1941

div1.p: Hench sends Mrs. Dimock a copy of his yellow fever article and mentions his visit with her brother.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mrs. Edward J. Dimock, November 22, 1941
div1.opener:
Carlos sent to Bullard
November 22, 1941
Mrs. Edward J. Dimock
Enderby
Manhasset, Long Island
New York
My dear Mrs. Dimock:
div1.p:
I recently had the pleasure of visiting your
brother, Mr. Bullard, in St. Augustine, in connection
with a study I am making of the conquest of yellow fever.
I learned much of interest from him. I thought you might
like to have the enclosed reprint. Unfortunately I was
unable to mention and describe herein the later work of
Dr. Carroll (Oct. 1901) in which your brother participated.
I am hoping to write a monograph on the entire subject and
this later work will be described therein.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
